pullRequest.body:
Adds a link to the CI run in the `lean4checker` message.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9298872769/job/25591603947)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9298872769/job/25591603508)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9298872769/job/25591603727)
Kim, thank you very much!  Except for `github.job`, everything else should have worked!
Shortened it, thanks!  This was for testing.

Entirely untested, but GPT says this could be:
```
- id: ci_url
  run: |
    url="https://github.com/${{ github.repository }}/actions/runs/${{ github.run_id }}"
    job_no="${{ github.job }}"
    full_url="${url}/jobs/${job_no}"
    echo "job_url=${full_url}" >> "$GITHUB_ENV"
 ```
 which is much nicer if true.
Sadly, `github.job` is the name of the job, not the number.  I had googled a bit, but could not find a GitHub API name for the job number.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - CI: `lean4checker` run also links to the CI run

nodes.body: Kim, thank you very much!  Except for `github.job`, everything else should have worked!
